msContents.summary: Receipt for payment of garden taxes for the year 145 AD. Paid by Athenarion the elder, daughter of Herodes

msItem.note: The hand is a tiny cursive

div.ab: The 9th year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrian Antoninus Augustus Pius, the 7th of Tybi. The elder Athenarion, daughter of Herodos, has paid through Zosimos and his associates in collecting taxes in silver the garden-taxes for the 8th year at [l. 5] Theadelphia, for vineyard 2440 drachmas in bronze, for the naubion beyond tax 120 drachmas, for additional fees 515 drachmas, for the land tax 1625 drachmas, additional fees 125 drachmas, for exchange 80, charge for preparing the receipt of drachmas in silver the gratuity of Dionyios 8 drachmas in silver, totals 8 drachmas additional fees 3 1/2 obols and 8 into the account for Phamenoth. . . . of the 8th year, for the vineyard 1440 drachmas, for the garden 570 drachmas, for the naubion 105 drachmas, additional fees 340 drachmas, for the land-tax 1400 drachmas, additional fees 110 drachmas, for the exchange 65 drachmas, for preparing the receipt [l. 10] of 8 drachmas in silver 2 drachmas, totals 2 drachmas and additional fees.

listBibl.bibl: P.Princ. III 125 SB XVIII 13091 P. J. Sijpesteijn, "Short Remarks on Some Papyri', Aegyptus 65 (1985): 35 L. C. Youtie, "A Second Century Taxpayer at Theadelphia," ZPE 17 (1975): 258-9
